thread.title: Top Gear fans say show is 'dead' as Matt LeBlanc and co-hosts revealed in official photo for new series | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Top Gear fans say show is 'dead' as Matt LeBlanc and co-hosts revealed in official photo for new series | London Evening Standard

author: Emma Powell
title: Top Gear fans say show is 'dead' as Matt LeBlanc and co-hosts revealed in official photo for new series | London Evening Standard
text:
Top Gear fans say show is 'dead' as Matt LeBlanc and co-hosts revealed in official photo for new series 
Matt LeBlanc, Chris Harris and Rory Reid will front the BBC motoring show Tuesday 14 February 2017 08:15 GMT Click to follow Father and teenage son among four dead in French avalanche 
Top Gear fans have been given a first look at the new presenting line-up – but they’re not impressed. 
The BBC motoring show released an image of Matt LeBlanc with Chris Harris and Rory Reid ahead of the new series in March. 
The revamped trio can be seen standing on a road surrounded by cars, with The Stig in the background and a helicopter and rocket overhead. 
The image was quickly criticised by some fans who claimed they had already turned their back on Top Gear in favour of Jeremy Clarkson ’s motoring show The Grand Tour . Revamped: The new series will air in March (BBC/PA Wire) 
Others said a revamped line-up won’t help as the show “died long ago”. 
One user tweeted: "Rory Reid is literally unwatchable: he just recycles Clarkson-esque comparisons. Harris mildly annoying. #TopGear just give it up." 
Another wrote: "Still not even one woman. So totally sexist that I can't even!!!" 
Others were more enthusiastic with one tweeting: "You guys are doing a great job with Top Gear keep it up." 
A second posted: "I think it's looking very good already! #TopGear #BBC #TV." New look: Matt LeBlanc with Chris Harris and Rory Reid(BBC) 
The first trailer for the latest series was released earlier this month and featured an array of vehicles, from the Aston Martin DB11 to the Ferrari FXX K and the Russian eight-wheeled Avtoros Shaman. 
The 90 second clip featured LeBlanc rescuing a group of naked ramblers on the Isle of Man and showed the new trio getting quizzed by a strict risk assessor on prior motoring convictions, whether they will participate in competitive driving, and if they require fire cover. New Top Gear trailer New Top Gear trailer 1/6 
Matt LeBlanc, Chris Harris and Rory Reid endure an awkward BBC car insurance interview interwoven with clips from the new series BBC/PA
